intro: Clidemia domingensis, commonly known as the velvetleaf or false hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the family Melastomataceae and is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces showy, five-petaled flowers in shades of white, pink, or purple, which bloom throughout the growing season. It is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. Clidemia domingensis is also known for its ability to thrive in disturbed soils and can sometimes become invasive in certain regions.
